company.name: RealPage, Inc.
company.business_description: RealPage provides tenant background screening solutions to rental property owners and property management companies, furnishing background reports that include rental histories, public record information (including criminal and eviction histories), and credit information from nationwide consumer reporting agencies.

case_info.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

complaint.factual_background: RealPage, Inc., a consumer reporting agency that provides tenant screening reports to landlords and property managers, failed to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of criminal record information in its reports. From at least January 2012 through September 2017, RealPage used overly broad matching criteria with inadequate filters, resulting in tenant screening reports that included criminal records belonging to different individuals. Despite receiving disputes about inaccurate reporting, RealPage did not make changes to address these failures, potentially causing housing denials based on incorrect information.

representations_made.description: RealPage was required under FCRA to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer reports
representations_made.quoted_text: Section 607(b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(b), requires that '[w]henever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.'

counts.title: Violations of Section 607(b) of the FCRA - Failure to Assure Maximum Possible Accuracy
counts.representation: RealPage was required to use reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer report information
counts.fact: RealPage failed to use reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy. It used broad matching criteria (soft matches on first names, middle names, and dates of birth), employed inadequate filtering (only filtering by middle name, state, and gender when available), failed to assess accuracy of results even when reports contained internal inconsistencies or information about multiple individuals, and did not address these failures despite receiving disputes. This resulted in reports including criminal records of individuals with different names, dates of birth, genders, races, and photographs.
counts.conclusion: Defendant has violated Section 607(b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §1681e(b), and pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, these acts and practices also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

definitions.Consumer Report: any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a Consumer Reporting Agency bearing on a consumer's credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumer's eligibility for (A) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes; (B) employment purposes; or (C) any other purpose authorized under FCRA Section 604, 15 U.S.C. § 168lb.
definitions.Consumer Reporting Agency: any person which, for monetary fees, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly engages in whole or in part in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information or other information on consumers for the purpose of furnishing Consumer Reports to third parties, and which uses any means or facility of interstate commerce for the purpose of preparing or furnishing Consumer Reports.
definitions.Defendant: RealPage, Inc. and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of information in Consumer Reports.

requirements.description: Must maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of Consumer Report information
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Defendant, Defendant's officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with operating as a Consumer Reporting Agency, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from failing to maintain reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom a Consumer Report relates.

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of three million dollars to the Commission.

requirements.description: Pay $3,000,000 civil penalty to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant is ordered to pay to the Commission three million dollars ($3,000,000), which, as Defendant stipulates, its undersigned counsel holds in escrow for no purpose other than payment to the Commission. Such payment must be made within seven (7) days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer in accordance with instructions previously provided by a representative of Commission.

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets and acknowledges facts for future litigation and tax reporting purposes.

requirements.description: Relinquish all rights to assets transferred pursuant to this Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant relinquishes dominion and all legal and equitable right, title and interest in all assets transferred pursuant to this Order and may not seek the return of any assets.

requirements.description: Acknowledge that Complaint facts will be taken as true in subsequent civil litigation
requirements.quoted_text: The facts alleged in the Complaint will be taken as true, without further proof, in any subsequent civil litigation by or on behalf of the Commission, including in a proceeding to enforce its rights to any payment or monetary judgment pursuant to this Order.

requirements.description: Acknowledge Taxpayer Identification Number may be used for collection and reporting
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant acknowledges that its Taxpayer Identification Number (Employer Identification Number), which Defendant previously submitted to the Commission, may be used for collecting and reporting on any delinquent amount arising out of this Order, in accordance with 31 U.S.C. §7701.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain and submit acknowledgments of receipt of this Order from itself and deliver copies to personnel with managerial responsibilities.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order to Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant, within seven (7) days of entry of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities, and successor entities for 3 years
requirements.quoted_text: For three (3) years after entry of this Order, Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees, agents, and representatives who have managerial responsibilities for the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Section titled Compliance Reporting. Delivery must occur within seven (7) days of entry of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt from each recipient
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Defendant delivered a copy of this Order, Defendant must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit compliance reports and notices to the Commission on specified timelines and for changes in business structure or bankruptcy.

requirements.description: Submit comprehensive compliance report one year after entry of Order
requirements.quoted_text: One year after entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury. Defendant must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission may use to communicate with Defendant; (b) identify all of Defendant's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business, including a description of any products and services that involve Consumer Reports; (d) describe in detail whether and how Defendant is in compliance with each Section of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Order Acknowledgment obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated point of contact or business structure for 10 years
requirements.quoted_text: For 10 years following entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following: (a) any designated point of contact; or (b) the structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has any ownership interest in or directly or indirectly controls that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of bankruptcy or insolvency filing within 14 days
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must submit to the Commission notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or any similar proceeding by or against Defendant within 14 days of its filing.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain specified records for 10 years after entry of Order, with each record retained for 5 years.

requirements.description: Create and maintain accounting records, personnel records, complaints, employee training materials, and compliance records
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, in connection with providing Consumer Reports, Defendant must create and maintain the following records: A. Accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold; B. Personnel records showing, for each employee: name, addresses, and telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and, if applicable, the reason for termination; C. Complaints and refund requests concerning the subject matter of the Order, whether received directly or indirectly, such as through a third party, and any response; D. All employee training materials concerning the subject matter of the Order; E. All records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through document requests, depositions, interviews, and other lawful means including undercover operations.

requirements.description: Respond to Commission requests for compliance reports, depositions, and document production within 14 days
requirements.quoted_text: Within 14 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Defendant must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury; appear for depositions; and produce documents, for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission to communicate directly with Defendant and interview employees
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, the Commission is authorized to communicate directly with Defendant. Defendant must permit representatives of the Commission to interview any employee or other person affiliated with Defendant who has agreed to such an interview. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

requirements.description: Allow Commission to use all lawful means including undercover operations for monitoring
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing, through its representatives, as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Defendant or any individual or entity affiliated with Defendant, without the necessity of identification or prior notice.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

duration.termination_text: For 10 years following entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following: (a) any designated point of contact; or (b) the structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has any ownership interest in or directly or indirectly controls that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.
